chapter.title: Plugins
chapter.para: CrunchyFrog can be extended with plugins. describes how to install and activate plugins; presents some plugins distributed with CrunchyFrog; gives some short notes about developing your own plugins.

section.title: Working with Plugins
section.para:
Plugins are managed within the preferences dialog:
File Preferences Plugins .

A list of all available plugins grouped by categories is shown on the left. Only plugins available locally are displayed by default. Activate the Enable repository checkbox to display plugins that are available online too.
To activate a plugin, activate the checkbox in front of the plugin's name. If a plugin you are about to activate is available online, you will be asked if you want to download this plugin now.
With the buttons on the right you can perform the following actions:

listitem.para: Install plugins locally from a *.zip file.
Shows additional information about a selected plugin.
Opens a dialog where you can configure a plugin. This button is active if a plugin provides it's own preferences.
Opens your default file manager with the user's plugin directory (~/.crunchyfrog/plugins). Changes in this folder become active without restarting CrunchyFrog.
Synchronize the list of plugins available online.

section.title: SQL Library
section.para: This plugins extends the menubar with an Library menu. Choose Add to library from this menu to add the content of the current SQL editor to your SQL library. Statements in your SQL library can be categorized.
The SQL library is intended as some kind of clipboard for commonly used statements.

section.title: Python Shell
section.para: The Python shell is mainly identend for plugin developers. It can be used to debug plugins and access CrunchyFrog internals.
section.tip: For further information about the Python shell read the Wiki and the API documentation.

section.title: Plugin Development
section.para: If you want to extend CrunchyFrog's functions please read the following documentations:
